Articles.Content:
Hello guys!

I have one big question. From last time I've didn't find a mark in steam to downgrade version to 1.3.0. Have you any ideas how to downgrade it? I have  a  lot of mods that don't work with 1.3.1

What mods work in 1.3 but not 1.3.1?

AFAIK, Steam has removed the option for the "beta" 1.3.

10 minutes ago, Geonovast said:

What mods work in 1.3 but not 1.3.1?

AFAIK, Steam has removed the option for the "beta" 1.3.

Why? A lot of mods, and the problem is that I don't remember all of it

Edited April 1, 2018 by DuskFall

I always keep my install folder away from steam, CKAN or anything that may change it, and a backup of a fresh install of the version I'm using (right now 1.3.1), plus a install to make tests, throwing mods recklessly in it. Glad is just a copy and paste, without any hassle.

1 hour ago, DuskFall said:

Why? A lot of mods, and the problem is that I don't remember all of it

It's not expected to have a mod working in 1.3 and not in the 1.3.1. If you are able to revert to 1.3.1, give us the names of the mods and maybe we'll be able to help.

1 minute ago, MaximumThrust said:

I always keep my install folder away from steam, CKAN or anything that may change it, and a backup of a fresh install of the version I'm using (right now 1.3.1), plus a install to make tests, throwing mods recklessly in it. Glad is just a copy and paste, without any hassle.

It's not expected to have a mod working in 1.3 and not in the 1.3.1. If you are able to revert to 1.3.1, give us the names of the mods and maybe we'll be able to help.

I may tell you what mods I use, but I don't remember. May be there is a way to find out what mods I use in one file?

1 minute ago, DuskFall said:

I may tell you what mods I use, but I don't remember. May be there is a way to find out what mods I use in one file?

Beforehand you should install mods compatible with 1.3.1. If there isn't a 1.3.1 version, you can try the 1.3.0 or even 1.2.2 and see how it goes.

You can take a look inside your GameData folder, in the KSP directory. By the name in the folders there you should be able to easily identify all, or near all, the mods that are installed. I suggest you make a clean install and re-download and re-install all the mods, to make everything clean and organized.

9 hours ago, DuskFall said:

I have  a  lot of mods that don't work with 1.3.1

Considering that 1.3.1 is the last 'stable' release of KSP, in terms of functionality and release date, the vast vast majority of mods work in 1.3.1, while they may not work in 1.3.0. 

If you want older versions of mods, look at the Spacedock Changelog for each mod, and it will list past versions of it.   There should be a similar resource on Github.

9 hours ago, Gargamel said:

If you want older versions of mods, look at the Spacedock Changelog for each mod, and it will list past versions of it.

Protip right here.  Definitely done this quiet a bit since 1.4 dropped the bomb.

17 hours ago, DuskFall said:

I may tell you what mods I use, but I don't remember. May be there is a way to find out what mods I use in one file?

If you have no clue what mods you are using, how do you get the idea that it will be any different if you would go back to 1.3?

Yes i play on 1.3.0 and Steam has removed this Version from the Beta option, i need to make a shortcut direct to the KSP.exe

 

@DuskFall i have a lot Backups of my 1.3.0 Version, if you want i can give the needed files for the 1.3.0 (is this allowed?)

6 minutes ago, SwissSpace93 said:

i have a lot Backups of my 1.3.0 Version, if you want i can give the needed files for the 1.3.0 (is this allowed?)

Technically no, but who's going to stop you?

I am not a lawyer, and am not responsible for any legal action taken against you by Squad or Take-Two

22 hours ago, Capt. Hunt said:

most 1.3.1 mods still work in 1.4.2

I'm afraid the problem *is* the 1.4.2, not the mods.

Can they please just fix 1.4.2???, my interplanetary space program needs refueling!!!

And right now all mining operations are in an *ON HOLD* status,

due to a sudden LT-2 Landing Leg default.

It would seem that these parts had been "over Ker-balled" back at the factory by the humans that work there....
